Welcome to ExPy’s documentation!¶

ExPy is a Python library for scientific computing.

It contains among other things:
  • sophisticated functions
  • useful rendering formula, Formula deformation.
  • simply converting Jupyter notebook to PDF.

ExPy is licensed under the Mit license, enabling reuse with few restrictions.

Getting Started¶

To install ExPy, we strongly recommend using a scientific Python distribution. See Installing the SciPy Stack for details.

For a quick introduction to ExPy we provide the ExPy Tutorial. We also recommend the SciPy Lecture Notes for a broader introduction to the scientific Python ecosystem.

Installation

  • 1. Installation
  • 2. Anaconda
  • 3. Git
  • 4. Run ExPy
  • 5. XeTeX

Documentation¶

The most up-to-date ExPy documentation can be found at Latest (development) version. It includes a user guide, full reference documentation and a developer guide. (which include the ExPy Roadmap and detailed plans for major new features).

Quickstart tutorial

  • 1. Prerequisites
  • 2. The Basics
  • 3. An example

Support ExPy¶

If you have found ExPy to be useful in your work, research or company, please consider making a donation to the project commensurate with your resources.
